The pseudoperoxidase activity is measured as described <sup>2</sup>, with modifications.
Add metHb into a substrate mixture containing 5.3 μM of CLA and 3.3 mM of H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub> in 150 μl of PBS \(pH 7.4).
2.  Continuously monitor the chemiluminescence, indicated by relative luminescence units \(rlu), at one reading per s, for 1 min, with Sirius luminometer \(Berthold Detection Systems GmbH, Germany).
The pseudoperoxidase activity of the metHb is designated as the relative luminescence units per second \(rlu/s).
To prove that the ROS species indicated by CLA-CL is superoxide anions, 3 Units/ml of SOD is applied to specifically quench the superoxide anions.
